alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Concordia (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 11:13PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Concordia and southern Catahoula Parishes through 1145 PM CDT... At 1112 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mayna, or near Larto, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Monterey around 1125 PM CDT. Wildsville around 1130 PM CDT. Frogmore around 1135 PM CDT. Ferriday, Clayton and West Ferriday around 1145 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ridgecrest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
